alert.note: Alert for Davidson; De Kalb; Smith; Sumner; Trousdale; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 5:42PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Smith, east central Davidson, northwestern De Kalb, southern Sumner, Wilson and southwestern Trousdale Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 542 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hendersonville to 6 miles north of Lebanon to near Watertown. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gallatin, Lebanon, Hartsville, Hendersonville, Mount Juliet, Lakewood, Watertown, Old Hickory, Alexandria, Dowelltown, Liberty, Green Hill, Tuckers Crossroads, Bledsoe Creek State Park and Dickerson Chapel Recreation Area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 230 and 256. Interstate 840 between mile markers 73 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Davidson; De Kalb; Smith; Sumner; Trousdale; Wilson
